revised_title: X-ray Investigation of Long-Chain Compounds: Crystal Structure and Peculiar Intensity Distribution
tldr: The authors investigated the crystal structure and intensity distribution of long-chain compounds using X-ray diffraction. They found that the compounds have an open structure with chains of carbon atoms loosely packed and parallel to each other. The intensity distribution of the X-ray reflections is explained by the arrangement of the carbon atoms in sets of equidistant layers, with strong reflecting planes containing the chain axis.
